subject: Add TDD settings documentation to agent-alchemy.local.md
description:
Document the TDD-specific settings that users can configure in `.claude/agent-alchemy.local.md`.

Update the settings documentation (or create a reference in tdd-tools) to include the following new configuration options:

**New Settings:**

```yaml
tdd:
  framework: auto                    # auto | pytest | jest | vitest
  coverage-threshold: 80             # Minimum coverage percentage (0-100)
  strictness: normal                 # strict | normal | relaxed
  test-review-threshold: 70          # Minimum test quality score (0-100)
  test-review-on-generate: false     # Run test-reviewer after generate-tests
```

**Setting Descriptions:**

- `tdd.framework`: Override auto-detection with explicit framework selection. Default: `auto` (use detection chain)
- `tdd.coverage-threshold`: Target coverage percentage for analyze-coverage reports. Default: `80`
- `tdd.strictness`: TDD strictness level affecting RED phase behavior:
  - `strict`: RED phase failure is mandatory — abort if tests pass before implementation
  - `normal`: RED phase failure is expected — warn but continue
  - `relaxed`: RED phase is informational — proceed regardless
- `tdd.test-review-threshold`: Minimum score for test quality. Tests below threshold are flagged. Default: `70`
- `tdd.test-review-on-generate`: Whether to automatically run test-reviewer after /generate-tests. Default: `false`

**Documentation Location:**
- Add to existing `.claude/agent-alchemy.local.md` pattern documentation
- Include in tdd-tools README.md settings section

**Acceptance Criteria:**

_Functional:_
- [ ] All 5 TDD settings documented with descriptions, types, and defaults
- [ ] Settings follow existing agent-alchemy.local.md YAML frontmatter convention
- [ ] tdd-tools README.md includes settings section
- [ ] Settings referenced by tdd-cycle, generate-tests, and analyze-coverage skills

_Edge Cases:_
- [ ] Invalid framework value: skills should fall back to auto-detection
- [ ] Coverage threshold out of range: skills should clamp to 0-100

_Error Handling:_
- [ ] Missing settings file: all skills use defaults
- [ ] Malformed YAML: skills use defaults with warning

**Testing Requirements:**
• Manual: Verify settings are parseable from agent-alchemy.local.md YAML frontmatter
• Manual: Validate that each skill correctly reads and applies these settings

Source: specs/tdd-features-SPEC.md Section 7.3, 9.3
